Hi Erik,

> > I personally distinguish between the traditional "Semantic We=
b" and
> "Linked
> > Data". Linked Data, for me, is just interlinked struct=
ured data and,
> as
> > that, a great match to RESTful systems.
> 
> that's=
 what one might naively think, reading the term as the
> combination
> of t=
he two words "linked" and "data". it turns out that the community
> that br=
ands itself as "linked data" is not quite as open in its
> interpretation, =
and claims that only RDF can be linked data

I know.. but insisting in some=
thing like this is just as naive. If you build a system that can't handle s=
uch ambiguities it just won't work at web scale. There are numerous example=
s.. one of them - perhaps not the best - are browser and their (sometimes i=
nsane) efforts to display your broken HTML. Where would the Web be if just =
100% valid markup would have been allowed - I frankly don't know but can't =
really believe that it would have been to the better.

But that's just my h=
umble opinion which won't interest the "Linked Data police" :-)



--
Marku=
